timeline.message: any resource name in resource definition annotation

timeline.bodyText: I think it might be clearer to move the earlier put call to an else block - so that every branch of this switch statement calls fieldEntityMap.put exactly once. (You could even extract this to a method which just returns "the value to put in the map" so you only have a single fieldEntityMap.put call.)
timeline.author: jskeet

replies.bodyText: I might be missing your point Jon, but the former put needs to be executed regardless of whether the resource has a * pattern, so I can't move it to the else block.
replies.author: yihanzhen

replies.bodyText:
You've currently got (pseudo-code)
put (key, value1)
if (condition)
  put (key, value2)

I'm suggesting that's better as:
if (condition)
  put (key, value2)
else
  put (key, value1)

So it's easy to see that in every path, the key is put exactly once. What's the benefit of putting unqualifiedName as the value and then putting "*" as the value? That's just overwriting it, right?
replies.author: jskeet

replies.bodyText:
Ahh I see the confusion here. fieldEntityMap is a Multimap- it supports duplicate keys.
https://github.com/googleapis/gapic-generator/pull/3163/files/74feb00d6b94ff04fed06c784bfcd826529246b3#diff-a0f27b8e4c41d2ebf887482b72314a58R82
replies.author: yihanzhen

replies.bodyText: Ah, that would definitely explain it. Thanks for clarifying.
replies.author: jskeet
